vocab.sampleSentence: The elf helped Santa make toys.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Chú yêu tinh đã giúp ông già Noel làm đồ chơi.

vocab.sampleSentence: He collects miniature cars.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Anh ấy sưu tập những chiếc xe hơi tí hon.

vocab.sampleSentence: They rode in a horse-drawn sleigh.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Họ đi trên một chiếc xe trượt tuyết do ngựa kéo.

vocab.sampleSentence: Reindeer live in cold climates.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Tuần lộc sống ở những vùng khí hậu lạnh.

vocab.vietnameseMeaning: truyền thuyết, kho tàng kiến thức
vocab.sampleSentence: The book is full of ancient lore.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Cuốn sách chứa đầy những truyền thuyết cổ xưa.

vocab.vietnameseMeaning: họa sĩ vẽ tranh biếm họa/hoạt hình

vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Họa sĩ biếm họa đã vẽ một bức tranh hài hước về tổng thống.

vocab.sampleSentence: Water is crucial for survival.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Nước là yếu tố cốt yếu để sinh tồn.

vocab.sampleSentence: He maintains a healthy lifestyle.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Anh ấy duy trì một lối sống lành mạnh.

vocab.sampleSentence: The carpenter has a workshop in his garage.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Người thợ mộc có một xưởng làm việc trong gara của mình.

vocab.sampleSentence: The illustrator created beautiful pictures for the book.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Người vẽ tranh minh họa đã tạo ra những bức tranh đẹp cho cuốn sách.

vocab.sampleSentence: The advertising campaign was very successful.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Chiến dịch quảng cáo đã rất thành công.

vocab.sampleSentence: They want to standardize the testing process.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Họ muốn tiêu chuẩn hóa quy trình kiểm tra.

vocab.sampleSentence: This is the latest version of the software.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Đây là phiên bản mới nhất của phần mềm.

vocab.sampleSentence: The Eiffel Tower is a global icon.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Tháp Eiffel là một biểu tượng toàn cầu.

vocab.sampleSentence: She is known for her charitable work.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Cô ấy nổi tiếng với công việc từ thiện của mình.

vocab.sampleSentence: Thank you for your kindness and generosity.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Cảm ơn lòng tốt và sự hào phóng của bạn.

vocab.sampleSentence: The team has a great fighting spirit.
vocab.vietnameseTranslation: Đội bóng có tinh thần chiến đấu tuyệt vời.

readingSlidesData.title: The True Story of Santa Claus

readingSlidesData.text: When people think of Christmas, the first image that often comes to mind is a jolly, overweight man with a white beard and a bright red suit. However, Santa Claus did not always look like the character we see in shopping malls today. His history is a fascinating mix of ancient legends, immigrant traditions, and modern marketing.

The story begins not at the North Pole, but in Myra (modern-day Turkey) during the 3rd century. There was a monk named St. Nicholas who was admired for his piety and kindness. Legends say he gave away all his inherited wealth and traveled the countryside helping the poor and sick. One famous story tells of how he secretly dropped a bag of gold down a chimney to help a poor father and his three daughters, which is the origin of the Christmas stocking tradition.

Over time, St. Nicholas became the most popular saint in Europe. When Dutch immigrants moved to New York in the late 18th century, they brought the story of "Sinterklaas" with them. Sinterklaas was depicted as a tall, slim bishop who rode a white horse. The name "Santa Claus" actually evolved from his Dutch nickname, Sinterklaas, which is a shortened form of Sint Nikolaas.

In the 19th century, American writers and artists began to transform Santa’s appearance. In 1822, Clement Clarke Moore wrote "The Night Before Christmas," describing Santa as a "right jolly old elf" with a miniature sleigh. Later, political cartoonist Thomas Nast added crucial details like the red suit and the North Pole workshop.

In the 1930s, Coca-Cola hired illustrator Haddon Sundblom for their holiday ads. Sundblom drew a Santa who was larger than life, with a warm, friendly face and a twinkling smile. He standardized the image of Santa as a grandfatherly figure drinking a soda. This version became the global icon we recognize today. Despite these changes, the core spirit of Santa Claus remains the same: the joy of giving to others.
